distributional 0.3.0.9000
  • Reference
  • Changelog

Sampling distribution

Source: R/dist_sample.R
dist_sample.Rd

dist_sample(x)

Arguments

x

A list of sampled values.

Examples

# Univariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10)))

dist
#> <distribution[2]>
#> [1] sample[100] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1]  0.05619751 10.12392115
variance(dist)
#> [1] 0.753658 1.041631
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.09700875  0.11432269
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>  [1]  0.06324932  0.64563448 -0.64820661 -1.06196862  0.35853227  0.79437842
#>  [7]  0.65911272  1.81497242  1.37434755  1.27067601
#> 
#> [[2]]
#>  [1]  8.851485 10.502471 11.213954  9.894064 11.645860 12.355156  9.306271
#>  [8]  9.266858 11.770356 11.075651
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2731769 0.0000000

# Multivariate numeric samples
dist <- dist_sample(x = list(cbind(rnorm(100), rnorm(100, 10))))

dist
#> <distribution[1]>
#> [1] sample[100]
mean(dist)
#> [1] -0.04437525  9.98000112
variance(dist)
#>           [,1]      [,2]
#> [1,] 1.0025098 0.1726515
#> [2,] 0.1726515 0.9654957
skewness(dist)
#> [1] -0.002371128
generate(dist, 10)
#> [[1]]
#>              [,1]      [,2]
#>  [1,] -0.49264670 10.805100
#>  [2,]  1.15989169  8.472607
#>  [3,] -0.12821607  9.955642
#>  [4,] -0.32983226  8.685043
#>  [5,]  0.38138535  9.561130
#>  [6,]  0.36344186  9.681403
#>  [7,]  0.00815468 11.744401
#>  [8,]  0.68921739 10.738938
#>  [9,]  0.12657842  9.726511
#> [10,]  1.15989169  8.472607
#> 

density(dist, 1)
#> [1] 0.2003762 0.0000000
